page.title: 13 Lifestyles
page.content: Transport a problem. Wives who cannot drive cannot shop.One village bus runs once weekly.Buying clothes,toys and home equipment by mail order is common Most school leavers buy a motor-cycle, a great worry to parents as roads are narrow and visibility poor.A young boy of 16 died after colliding with a cattle truck. Villagers turned out in force,chapel was overflowing, service was relayed to several hundred outside Families are close,much liaison between grandparents, aunts, uncles and cousins who grow up together,some inter-marry.Some children attend the primary schools their parents went to. Fathers role is as bread winner,mother takes charge of the children.Family visits to the moors and beach are more common.The Social Services provides hot meals daily to pensioners and also runs a home help service.
